title: _act_
author: _act_
content: Not new but people still falling to be victims of malware. The country that is mostly affected is United States.Malware attacks that has been noticed since December 22:Laplas ClipperIt is a clipboard malware. Check the address you are sending to again and again before sending. Try all way possible to avoid malware, it is very important if you want to protect your coins. We know what clipboard malware is. Mortal Kombat ransomwareStealing the name from a common video game that we all know, it is a ransomware. You need to read this in details, very important: https://www.malwarebytes.com/blog/news/2023/02/mortal-kombat-ransomware-forms-tag-team-partnership-with-laplas-clipperThe malware are downloaded as usual, through email. Learn how to avoid malware if you know you want to protect yourselves. Do not forget that the safest wallets are cold wallets and hardware wallets, but clipboard malware may still be able to penetrate all kinds of wallets.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Despite the different names, the way it works is similar, which is that it tries to deceive the user into voluntarily giving his money to the third party, and thus with a little care you can avoid most of them, such as checking addresses several times, not downloading random programs, learning more, and allocating cold storage with a device Separate broadcast transactions.With increasing awareness, all these attacks are expected to fail.

comments.author: drwhobox
comments.body: I Always avoid scam emails and double-check after copying any important text or wallet. This is a serious issue. How can a virus replace a wallet address from the clipboard, and how does it know that the user will send bitcoin? Some days ago, I got several unknown email to my primary email that my metamask account is at risk, I avoid the emails because I already heard about that scam from this forum. I think this year, many new way of scams and viruses will be introduced.

comments.author: coin-investor
comments.body: Knowledge and awareness are the best defense, you may have the best antiviruses in the market but if you keep on clicking unwanted ads and links one of these malware can get in unnoticed.I am still a Windows user because of the application that I'm using, so I have a heightened alert about this malware, knowledge and the best AVs in the market are just two ways to combat getting your PC infected. You really have to know what to avoid scammers are good at marketing and cloaking their malware.

comments.author: dansus021
comments.body: It is everywhere, and yes we need to double-check everything when it comes to the internet. The virus can enter to our computer in many ways including what OP said "Mortal Kombat that contain viruses". There is a virus through email and there is through and ads or Phishing websites. I will share a tips including using VPN and Adblocker and never open and link or item that have been send to your Email, telegram or discord that you don't know the person is. Scan on virustotal website is right to do.
